https://www.acslaw.org/judicial-nominations/senate-votes/
Senate Votes
The data below documents how each U.S. Senator in the 119th Congress has voted on the confirmation of judges. All data is compiled via the U.S. Senate website. Voice votes are counted as "yea" votes.
Katie Britt
Republican
119th Congress
Alabama
Votes on Judicial Confirmations During Trump 2025-present Administration
Katie Britt (Republican)
Total: 5
Katie Britt (Republican)
119th Congress
Alabama
| Judge | Vote |
|---|---|
| Whitney D. Hermandorfer (6th. Cir) | Yea |
| Joshua M. Divine (E.D. Mo, W.D. Mo) | Yea |
| Cristian M. Stevens (E.D. Mo) | Yea |
| Zachary M. Bluestone (E.D. Mo) | Did Not Vote |
| Emil Bove (3rd Cir.) | Yea |

President Biden had 235 Article III judges confirmed during his administration. The data below documents how each U.S. Senator in the 117th and 118th Congresses voted on the confirmation of those 235 judges. All data is compiled via the U.S. Senate website. Voice votes are counted as "yea" votes.

President Trump had 234 Article III judges confirmed during his administration. The data below documents how each U.S. Senator in the 115th and 116th Congresses voted on the confirmation of those 234 judges. All data is compiled via the U.S. Senate website. Voice votes are counted as "yea" votes.
